description:
I made a bridge transaction on jumper exchange from an EVM wallet to Solana wallet A. I did that successfully and sent a small amount from Solana wallet A to Solana wallet B. Solana wallet B was hacked by this same hacker about a month ago, but I had a token there that I wanted to transfer to Solana wallet A. After sending that small amount to B, I swapped the token for SOL and transferred it to A. I was just about to transfer SOL from A to a CEX when I noticed that the balance reduced to 0. I checked the transaction history and saw that it was transferred out; a transaction which I did not make. I checked wallet B and saw the same thing; zero balance, a send transaction that I did not make and to the same wallet address.D9wHtmY3wyonSM3JHHWQj8dRXpmTCuSXUVvbDhjJLPkZ (hacker's address).

I made a bridge transaction on jumper exchange from an EVM wallet to Solana wallet A. I did that successfully and sent a small amount from Solana wallet A to Solana wallet B. Solana wallet B was hacked by this same hacker about a month ago, but I had a token there that I wanted to transfer to Solana wallet A. After sending that small amount to B, I swapped the token for SOL and transferred it to A. I was just about to transfer SOL from A to a CEX when I noticed that the balance reduced to 0. I checked the transaction history and saw that it was transferred out; a transaction which I did not make. I checked wallet B and saw the same thing; zero balance, a send transaction that I did not make and to the same wallet address.

D9wHtmY3wyonSM3JHHWQj8dRXpmTCuSXUVvbDhjJLPkZ (hacker's address).

Amount lost

The following sites have been reported by users as potentially fraudulent. These links are provided for reference and investigative purposes only, not as endorsements.

jumper.exchange

jumper.exchange
